titleStmt.title: The doue and the serpent In which is conteined a large description of all such points and principles, as tend either to conuersation, or negotiation.
titleStmt.author: D. T. (Daniel Tuvill), d. 1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T[homas] C[reede] for Laurence L'isle, dwelling at the Tygre's head in S. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Dedication signed: D.T., i.e. Daniel Tuvill.
Another issue (STC 24394a) has cancel title page with a comma after "dove".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: the Tygre's head in S. Pauls Church-yard
